page.title: 01Summary Of Our Area
page.content: The block we have studied is S.E. of Carlisle.It is mainly agricultural and most of the land is used for sileage or pasture, although there is some barley grown for feeding stock.Most farms are dairy with herds of British Friesian.Few hedges have been taken out so our countryside is criss-crossed with hedges of hawthorn,blackthorn,blackberry,some crab apple,wild plum and ash. There is a sprinkling of many other trees but no large areas of standing timber. There are two villages in our area,Wetheral and Cumwhinton and two which overlap,Scotby and Great Corby.There has been a lot of building in Wetheral and Scotby less in Great Corby and very little in Cumwhinton.Many of the people living in the villages work in Carlisle.
